Ehn/PC 5/13/2023 7:16 PM
Thereâ€™s a new Carlfield comic.
Hav Kerloe 5/13/2023 7:17 PM
Naturally, I read it.
Hav Kerloe
There are three rooms in my apartment, and I enter the second one. It is a kitchen, but I prefer to call it the fish room, because there are several fish tanks in it. Ironically, the fish room is also where I cook and eat fish. As much as I would love to cook a delicious fish breakfast, my work takes priority. I enter the third and final room of the apartment, the restroom. I brush my teethâ€”an important activity, though I'm unsure why. I wonder if Carlfield brushes his teeth. He takes the idea of hating Mondays from humans, despite it being meaningless to him, so why not brushing teeth as well? Finally, I feed the many fish in the fish room. I wonder which is more importantâ€”feeding the fish, or brushing my teeth? What a fascinating dilemma. However, the answer is obviousâ€”of course feeding the fish is more important. Brushing my teeth does not keep me alive. Feeding the fish does keep them alive. If I stopped feeding the fish, it would affect their lives, it would kill them. As the owner of a fish store, I am responsible for the deaths of many fish. Of course, the lives of fish are unimportant. I don't know why this is, but it's true. I'm suddenly struck with an idea. I reach my hand into one of the tanks, and take a fish out of it. I rush to my bedroom with the squirming fish in my hand, and open the window. I then drop the still living fish out of it, onto the streets of Avengard below. I close the window, and return to the fish room. I'm spreading fish to the people. What a wonderful thought, someone being able to witness the death of a fish right before their eyes. Will they understand? Will they see that this doesn't matter, because society has told them that this fish's life is meaningless? Will they be confused as to why a fish is dying right in front of them? They shouldn't be. Why would a fish's death only matter if you specifically are the one who witnesses it? Like Carlfield eating his lasagna, people are ignorant to the idea that things must happen to cause their everyday activities. Yes. I will write to John David and tell him my idea. I grab a pen and a piece of paper, and begin to write. To John David, creator of Carlfield I think that it would be very interesting if you were to have a Carlfield comic strip in which Carlfield must confront the ways his beloved lasagna is made. He would be disgusted at first, but he would realize that there is no reason to be discomforted by this, and understand that he always knew that his lasagna would be made like this. Seeing it makes no difference. This realization could also potentially spur Carlfield into understanding why his hatred of Mondays is illogicalâ€”he is a cat, not a human. Human logic does not matter to him. I do not require credit for use of my idea. Thank you, Hav Kerloe (owner of Kerloe Fishery) I place the letter in an envelope, then attach the requisite postage stamps to the envelope. I wonder how I will find out where to send this letter for it to reach John David. I don't use the internet, so looking it up there would not be possible. I decide that I will ask the next person I communicate with to search it for me. I take the letter and a pen and place them in my pocket. I then take my keys and exit my apartment. (edited)
Ehn/PC 5/13/2023 7:20 PM
The first panel has Carlfield excitedly notice the Lasagna Factory. The second panel has him run inside and be disturbed by the lasagna factoryâ€™s process. The third panel has him eat the lasagna right off the production machines while thinking "Hey, at least it isnâ€™t Monday."
Ehn/PC 5/13/2023 10:10 PM
((Saturday))
Ehn/PC 5/21/2023 10:58 PM
((Saturday))
Hav Kerloe 5/27/2023 1:42 PM
What...? No. This can't. No. This makes no sense. This is too... No. That's not right. I can't understand this. This isn't what Carlfield is supposed to be. This is unbelievable. Who did this? Did I do this? That makes no sense. I couldn't have done this, that isn't possible. I couldn't possibly have done this. It is impossible for me to have done this. Me doing this is not a possibility. I can't understand how this happened. I can't figure out the reason. It's not right. Something feels off. Wrong. Unnatural. The world doesn't work this way. Something is broken. I feel that there's some sort of distinct force pushing against me, but I can't tell what it is. It's too much. How am I supposed to think about this? I can't believe something like this. I'm right. I've solved everything. Reality is mine. That's just how it works. And yet, this doesn't make sense. This isn't normal. Life doesn't work like this. I take a moment to look at today's Carlfield again. It's so obvious now. I did this. But I'm not supposed to do this, am I? I'm supposed to not do anything. People are supposed to not do anything. People aren't supposed to trust or believe anything anyone else says. That's how the world works. That's the expression of collective understanding. We all agree to ignore each other, we all agree to never go further than the absolute, undeniable surface, because doing so would be meaningless. All life is the same. That's how the world works. People would never believe me. Nobody would ever trust me. That isn't a possibility. I'm not someone who can be trusted. I'm an unfathomable, incoherent freak. People should not be able to tell that I'm right. But I am right. I am right. I know that. I am certain. I've always been certain. But this confirmation, that...that doesn't make sense. I don't feel anything different. Everything is the same. Everyone should agree to ignore me. That's what they should be doing. I shouldn't have a place, or a purpose, or a viewpoint into anything. I am like a fish. I should be cut up into pieces and exist for others to feed off of. I have no individuality. So...what should my reaction be here? Can I deny this? No, because it's too understandable. I can't recognize something here as coherent, because I struggle to understand anything. I don't know what's happening around me. I don't see anything. I can't see anything. Please, someone help me understand. This isn't funny. There's no joke. There shoukld be a joke. There should be something for me to deny, there should be a rift between perceivable reality and my understanding of the truth. But there isn't. Where is it? I can't find it. I can't find anything. (edited)

Hav Kerloe 5/27/2023 3:13 PM
I'm upset. Clearly. This represents something, doesn't it? Things are the same. It doesn't seem like anything has changed. But something within me feels as if it's uncovered itself. There's some truth that I've found, even if I can't exactly tell what that truth is. The fish dying doesn't matter. It doesn't matter at all. There's nothing wrong with that. They accepted their fates. That's why they exist. They're part of a larger whole, and individually, they are meaningless. Why am I upset? There's something for me to be angry about, there's a frustration I feel at the world outside of me. But I'm not sure what that frustration is. I'm not sure how I'm supposed to connect what I'm feeling now with what happened before. But, I understand things so well. So, when something goes wrong, then maybe that's when I stop having the ability to exist as it is correct to. Right now, I'm worthless. I am right where I belong. The fish are dead. I think I might be jealous of the fish. I think they live the ideal lives. I think I should have lived that life too. I think there's no reason to do anything here. This isn't the truth. Nothing has been uncovered. I just have to accept this. That's what I am. I've lost something. Something very important to me. But I don't know what.
Ehn/PC 5/27/2023 3:33 PM
Alien hand syndrome is a rare occurrence in which people begin to experience their hands moving without their choice. They don't understand what pieces of themselves are doing. Like puppets for something outside of their vision, they move without passion or purpose. But while hands are the known phenomenon, I believe many people experience it all the time in all sorts of ways. If unconscious uncontrollable movements are a strange and disturbing phenomenon, then what is every single day of my life? I act because I'm supposed to. I think because I'm supposed to. I feel because I'm supposed to. My conscious brain has no effect on these things. It merely listens and follows, in a pattern not decided by my mind. Or... Perhaps it is decided by my mind. If you asked me what I had or had not chosen, I would answer that I had chosen all of it. I don't... Understand. And yet I do. So when you ask of me what I have done, it is undeniable that I am at fault. And yet I didn't choose any of it. Am I... Even me? I've never experienced the desire to want something. To want to do something. Maybe once. Once, long ago, I felt what it was like to live. I knew sadness, happiness, anger. I laughed, cried, and got angry. Maybe. It's a nice idea, but not one I can really conceive. In my life, I don't really feel these core pieces people find in humanity. It's like I'm a machine, making assumptions based off of observation and mimicking them in some kind of automated process. A tragedy has occurred? In my heart, I don't really care. Maybe it's because it doesn't affect me. Maybe it's because I'm a cruel person. And yet... I cry.
3:35 PM
Tears surprise me just as much as any other shock. More surprising than any tragedy is the fact my body apparently cares. Was I sad...? I didn't know. I never know. I just do as it says, and assume that I do care. Like a machine, I continue. I continue. I continue. I'm so sorry for your loss. I know you truly cared about those fish, Hav. Avengard / hav-kerloe
Ehn/PC 9/30/2023 2:02 PM
Hav wakes up the next morning.
Hav Kerloe 9/30/2023 3:38 PM
I get up. It's a Wednesday, which is the day of the week. This day of the week is Wednesday, which is good. I have work today. My brother is still missing, which is good. I need to go to work today. Carlfield would go to work today, which is Monday. The day of the week in which Carlfield is upset. Traditionally in society, people wake up in the morning on Monday. It's the first day in which they go to work, every Monday. In comparison to Sunday, in which there is no work, this is disappointing. The irony of this is that Carlfield is a cat, who does not have a job. Therefoere, there is functionally no difference between Monday and other days to him. The veil of comedy is established by the way Carlfield's feelings on Mondays mean nothingâ€”the cat has convinced himself that this matters to him, somehow. I am like Carlfield, as I work every day. But unlike Carlfield, I am aware. Which is good. I brush my teeth. I feed the fish, which need to eat. If they want to survive, they have to eat, but they can't eat without my help. They are just like me, who cannot eat without my help. I cannot brush my teeth without my help. Today I brush my teeth, which happens often. I don't know why. I decide to head to the place I work, that being the therapy office, where I sell fish to various customers.
Ehn/PC 9/30/2023 3:40 PM
Matrick is there, at the office. "Oh... Hi, Hav."
Hav Kerloe 9/30/2023 3:41 PM
"Hello. How did things go yesterday?"
Ehn/PC 9/30/2023 3:42 PM
"Not, uh... Not great. Pretty bad actually. But uh... That's a corpse, right? How else was I supposed to react?"
Hav Kerloe 9/30/2023 3:42 PM
"I understand." I wait for further instructions.
Ehn/PC 9/30/2023 3:44 PM
"So uh... What can we do? What can... She died, right? So... We can be sure the danger is real."
Hav Kerloe 9/30/2023 3:45 PM
"That's correct. Did you tell the authorities anything?"
Ehn/PC 9/30/2023 3:46 PM
"Well, obviously... But they- They weren't willing to listen. I don't understand why! How... How dangerous is this? We're... This is reality, right? Conspiracy theories can't just come true!"

Hav Kerloe 11/14/2023 5:48 PM

Ehn/PC 11/14/2023 5:50 PM
This is the first.
Hav Kerloe 11/22/2023 10:36 AM
Huh. This is certainly an interesting piece. The most immediately noticeable aspect of this one is the mention of "real problems". It seems to imply a sort of "unrealness" to other problems, which is...accurate, but not quite on the mark when taken in context. Yet what John David's inspiration truly seems to be here is the nature of Carlfield as a representation of the unawareness of people. This "problem" isn't real because Carlfield isn't real. He is a fictional character, and both John David and the audience knows this. Yet, he claims it is real, thus mocking the idea that any problems are real. The real core of this strip is not in the dialogue, however; it is in the art. Carlfield turns to the audience in panel two, before looking the reader straight in the eyes. He gazes into the reader's soul, preparing a direct comparison between himself and them. They are the same. And John David is right. This problem is meaningless. Having an itch you can't scratch is meaningless. Every problem in life is like that, and Carlfield mocks this. When people think they are "struggling", they are merely being Carlfield, lamenting their minor discomfort. But then, they hit that breakthrough, that moment of awareness. They find the truth. It's all a performance for Carlfield, because in this world, he knows. He wants to show you. That's why he exists. John David is sacrificing so, so much for this. That's the question I still have... Why? Why would he be willing to spread this knowledge? Is it not better for Carlfield to turn the other way? Is it not better for Carlfield to leave his thoughts unstated? (edited)
Ehn/PC 11/22/2023 10:48 AM
This is the second.
Hav Kerloe 11/22/2023 12:33 PM
Now this...this might illuminate quite a bit. James tells Carlfield to do nothing, and nothing is done. But, the real curiosity here is the way James feels the need to announce 'doing nothing'. He lacks the same understanding that Carlfield does, that nothing is the state of existence one always maintains. It's delusion to feel the need to do anything more. You're only making yourself suffer, that way. We can additionally compare this to the methods John David uses to write Carlfield. He does too much, every day, with every new Carlfield strip. He is a living contradiction, spreading a message at odds with the nature of spreading a message in the first place. In either case, I feel as if this strip illuminates things for me. Because it's obvious that, from a literal perspective, James and Carlfield are a single entity. They are nothing more than a conglomeration of the internal workings of a human mind. Conflict between the real and unreal, the desire for giving into external pressure and the need to embrace one's own true self. In that case, this announcement truly is meaningless. So, then, what am I doing? Why am I here? Who am I talking to right now? Is there a reason that I wake up in Avengard, it's a new day in Avengard. I feed the fish. I go to feed the fish. I go feed the fish. In Avengard, I go feed the fish. I get up and go feed the fish. I walk up the stairs to feed the fish. I am in Avengard right now. (edited)
Ehn/PC 11/22/2023 12:38 PM
This succeeds.
Hav Kerloe 11/22/2023 12:39 PM
I sleepin avneglarid
Ehn/PC 11/22/2023 12:43 PM
((The chapter ends))

??? 11/30/2023 5:31 PM
Sometimes, I wake up and think to myself how beautiful this world is.
5:31 PM
We're blessed to exist, are we not? It's a miracle. If only a single small thing was different, we as individuals would no longer be the same person. We'd be changed irreversibly. (edited)
5:33 PM
It sounds disturbing, but I think it's comforting more than anything. I value myself all the more because my existence is special. That's what I've always been told, and I have believed it wholeheartedly.
5:35 PM
In our boundless search for uniqueness, we fail to consider those that value us most. Haven't you ever experienced something like that? A parent, teacher, or maybe even a friend...confirming for you how much you matter.
5:35 PM
Communicating how different things would be if you didn't exist. (edited)
5:36 PM
But then, you take a step forward into the next stage of life, and there's that single moment of change.
5:36 PM
I look at the fish. I kill the fish. The fish is dead because of me. It's my special talent. My ability. That's who I am.
5:37 PM
If you can kill and eat the fish, then can't you kill and eat the human too? What's the difference between the two?
5:37 PM
A stupid question, at first glance.
5:37 PM
But I'm not the one who asked it.
5:39 PM
My talent gains meaning. And I embrace that meaning, because there's nothing else. I love myself. I love how unique I am. And I'm proud to be loved by myself. (edited)
5:40 PM
The moment I was told that something was wrong with me sticks in my mind forever. I can still hear the voice. I hear it every day. (edited)
5:40 PM
But it's something to overcome.
5:40 PM

Ehn/PC 1/8/2024 1:02 PM
Josh Maoziwam is sitting in his father's office. Shuichi Maoziwam sits across from him, engaged in an extensive lecture about his business practices and what he expects out of his successor. ...I'm hungry. That's how I am feeling right now. I want to fill the void in my stomach with food, something deeply filling that will not leave me hungry anymore. For a while, at least. Naturally, I'll have to eat again for dinner. Dinner is the 3rd meal of the day, which makes it even more important than the second or first. This is because it is more closely associated with the number 3. 3 is an important number. It's an important number because my father only has 2 children. Myself and Lelouch. If he had 3, then the 3rd would probably want to take up the position of inheriting his business empire. The 3rd day of the week is Wednesday, which is the day that today isn't. My father wants an heir because like my stomach, he wants some part of him to be filled. Everything in this instance would be solved by the number 3. Or higher. There are actually numbers higher than 3 that might also help, but there aren't more than 3 meals in a day. Because there are more 3 meals in a weak though, you could count higher with that too. It all depends on the perspective you are coming from. Unfortunately, as the son of Shuichi Maoziwam, I have the most unique perspective ever. That means there are only 3 meals in a day. Josh. "...Are you listening?" Shuichi. "Yes." Josh nods seriously, despite the fact this is a lie. "You've been strangely quiet during this lesson. Have I left you confused or anything?" Shuichi. "No." Josh. "Perfect. What a great student." Shuichi smiles smugly.
Ehn/PC 1/8/2024 1:15 PM
"Shall we take a break then?" Shuichi. Josh nods and leaves. Another successful lecture. The trick to evading my fatherâ€™s long rambles about himself is to ramble even longer in my own head, that way I appear very deep in thought about what he has to say and can thus focus on things more personally interesting to me. My father wants a lot from me, and heâ€™s very overbearing. I have no interest in running any sort of business. I have money. A lot of it. Making money is the point of a business. Why would I run a business to make what I already have? Am I supposed to mimic my father? That would be pointless, because my father already exists. Heâ€™s also full of flaws that I donâ€™t have, like the obsession with the sound of his own voice. Iâ€™m also obsessed with the sound of my own thoughts, which donâ€™t make any but feel almost like they do. Thatâ€™s why I donâ€™t have any of my father's flaws, and I donâ€™t intend to develop them. I have flaws too, but I donâ€™t think theyâ€™d go away by being my father. Every human being has flaws, actually, which is weird. Why do people have flaws? Werenâ€™t they created by evolution which is designed to remove the flaws? Animals probably donâ€™t have any flaws. I donâ€™t have a favourite animal because they donâ€™t have brains and are thus all the same, but theyâ€™re probably all are at least superior to humans which have brains but also have flaws. It would probably be fun to be an animal that wasnâ€™t a human.
Ehn/PC 1/8/2024 1:29 PM
On a whim, he decides to check his sisterâ€™s room. Sheâ€™s watching some anime Josh has never bothered to learn the name of. He sits next to her silently. She looks comforted by this but doesnâ€™t say anything either, sheâ€™s used to this sort of silence from her brother.
1:29 PM
She's watching a television show. It looks animated, and the dialogue is incoherent so it has to be written at the bottom. Why? Were the voice actors that bad? My personal theory for this is that it may contribute to the greater themes. Thereâ€™s a bible story my mother taught me once about people who built a really tall tower and then forgot to speak English. The bible is a really big book that was made a long time ago so they could invent metaphors with it. A metaphor is what happens when you say something that isnâ€™t true but invents new meaning by comparison so itâ€™s actually really deep. I live in a really tall tower, but I still remember how to speak English so this metaphor doesnâ€™t apply to me. But the people on the screen might also be in a tall tower, or they might be talking like this because we are. The English has to be projected onto them. Thatâ€™s the metaphor. I havenâ€™t seen most of these episodes, so I donâ€™t know. I just catch some of them when I sit with my sister. I donâ€™t actually pay attention to the drawings on the screen either because I donâ€™t care about that either. I donâ€™t particularly care about anything. Itâ€™s okay, though. Iâ€™m a brother, which means I am supposed to let my sister feel loved. Thatâ€™s a role that was ascribed onto me, so I canâ€™t deny it like I deny my father. I just have to sit next to her sometimes and pretend I care, which isnâ€™t very hard. Not many things are hard, because I have money. But this doesnâ€™t involve money, it just involves sitting next to her. I canâ€™t meaningfully help her about anything, but thatâ€™s not why Iâ€™m alive. Even if it might be nice to help someone, Iâ€™m not able to. Iâ€™m not a police officer, or a firefighter, or anything like that. I donâ€™t want to risk my life.
1:36 PM
Most days in Josh Maoziwamâ€™s life are like this. He rarely leaves home, apart from when his father brings him somewhere. He was homeschooled when he was younger, so he never had the opportunity to make friends then either. The first time he met someone younger than him was his sister, and he was already an adult by that point. He never understood how to properly connect with her, but he repeated the same principles regardless in order to recreate moments she seemed to enjoy. So he ends up sitting silently next to her very often, like he did many years later in a car.
Ehn/PC 1/8/2024 1:43 PM
His mother and his father are in the front seat. Lelouch looks tired next to him. They're sitting together too, and theyâ€™re not talking. Itâ€™s very rare for my father to not talk. I heard he and she had some sort of falling out recently. Iâ€™m not supposed to tell Lelouch, according to him. Does that mean itâ€™s about her? My dad loves my sister, so maybe my mother doesnâ€™t. It would very sad for her to learn sheâ€™s unloved. It might be like if she could read my mind and learn I never watched her animated drawings on the TV. It must be very sad to be unloved for people who care about that. Thatâ€™s why Iâ€™m supposed to work hard to- His inner monologue was interrupted by another car coming out of nowhere and Shuichi swerving hard into a wall to try to avoid it on reflex. Both collide with the car regardless.
1:47 PM
Josh looks around. The front of the car and my sister's side are hurt badly. This would be very unlucky if I were my mother, since she took both hits at once. That was a very poor mistake on my fatherâ€™s part. This is why itâ€™s unfortunate that people haveâ€¦ People haveâ€¦ Hm. I feel strangely lightheaded. I must need some fresh air. He tries to open his window, but itâ€™s broken. He tries to kick open the door, and falls out of the car. "Ow!"
1:52 PM
He looks at the drops of blood falling from his head onto the ground. "â€¦What? Am I bleeding? How unfortunate." He lays there, but the bleeding doesnâ€™t stop. He pulls out his phone and dials 911. "This is 911. What is your emergency?" 911 responder. Josh pauses instead of answering. Is this really what Iâ€™m supposed to do? What if my father or my sister would rather take responsibility for saving us. It might be too selfish of me to speak myself. Iâ€™m feeling really tired now. Like my sister. Perhaps itâ€™s a sign we are trading places. She should be the one to take the phone and save us." He throws the phone into the car. *And I should justâ€¦ Goâ€¦ toâ€¦ sleepâ€¦ Josh Maoziwam lost consciousness.
Ehn/PC 1/8/2024 2:00 PM
The next time he awoke, he was in the FB's laboratory. He learned later that they had rerouted the ambulance here in order to let them be operated more safely. These details may be skipped because they donâ€™t particularly deserve their own scene. After waking up, he made his way out of his room and met FB himself. "Am I alive?" Josh. "Yes." FB nodded. "We were able to stabilize the 3 of you." "â€¦The 3 of us?" Josh speaks without thinking. "Ah, yes. Your mother passed away. I never knew my mother very well, so Iâ€™m afraid I donâ€™t the lengths to which this may affect you emotionally." FB. Josh waited patiently for some kind of strong feeling to wash over him. Huh. But nothing came. "No, thatâ€™s fine."
Ehn/PC 1/14/2024 12:09 PM
"I see, very well then." FB nodded. "I suppose you must have plenty of questions now, yes?" "Yes." Josh nodded. "Ask away." FB. "Who are you?" Josh. "My name is... FB. That is not my real name in any sense, but it is the name from which I operate while I work here." FB. "What is here?" Josh. Of course, I understand the concept of here. It is the place on which I am presently located. Not just this specific spot, but the whole building as well. I don't know what this building is. I'm supposed to ask what the building is. That's probably what he wants from me. Also... I am a bit curious, as well.
12:13 PM
"That may be better explained with a tour of the place. Please, follow me." FB led him out of the room. Naturally, Josh had no reason to follow. A conversation about pointless details happened as they walked, but it's of no relevance to anyone. They eventually reached a series of 3 doors. Next to each door was the name of it's occupant. 'Elizabeth Bachman', 'Hav Shaun Kerloe', 'Nathan Smith'. "This is the core of the project we work on for your father. Project EHN." FB. Josh watched silently. "Tell me, Josh... Where do you believe a person's self lies?" FB. Lying is when people say things that aren't true. That means that when a person's self lies, they have to be speaking. Obviously, he must be asking for me to say their words. "Their words." Josh.
Ehn/PC 1/14/2024 12:20 PM
"Their words? Hm... I suppose that is a separate matter of philosophy. I am not asking you what defines your definition of self... I mean what created it. Where does it live? What is the beating heart of who you are?" FB. "My body." Josh. "In a sense, perhaps. Your body is where your mind is contained. But a body is shaped by the mind much more than the body shapes the mind. Your psychological state affects much more than mere emotion, it defines even the outwardly visible proportions of your self. A mere photograph of your body could tell me so much about who you are and what you have lived. Because that is the true answer. Memory. Our experiences are what define us. If any other man lived the life I had, they would be indistinguishable from me. All humans are, in essence, the same. You and I are the same, Josh." FB. "Are you sure?" Josh. "100%. I speak not of conjecture, but of hard and undeniable data." FB.
Ehn/PC 1/14/2024 12:33 PM
"What is that data?" Josh. This can't be true. I am not a normal member of society. My father, my mother, my sister, and most likely everyone else can experience an unforced sense of normalcy. They experience frequent joy and strong emotions. They are the definition of a correct human I am forced to follow every single day. We are not the same. Otherwise, what would be the point? Why would my father have put in so much effort to accrue so much wealth? Why would people do anything? Why would a shopkeeper wake up every day and go to work? Why would he not simply kill himself? "When I was a young man, I struggled to connect with my peers. I felt alienated and special. I believed there was some piece of me that was impossible to ever be shared with another living human being. I was completely and utterly alone. I spent my days walking the streets and observing people I believed I could never understand. It was like observing an indescribable horror. What joy did they find in things I considered utterly meaningless? Why did they pour their souls out into work I could never understand the meaning of. We live in a difficult society, one that requires constant and unstopping work. What was the home of 'art' in this world? Why did so many seek it out? Why did so many bother to connect with one another? It all felt... So impossibly complex. An inescapable universal enigma." FB starts to cry slightly. "And then one day... It all made sense. I had been looking it all wrong. I was so busy beating myself down for my differences I struggled to realize that what mattered had been what had created them. Why was I born different? An outcast? I had always believed it was my fate, and I hated myself deeply for not being the man everyone else was. And indeed, it was my fate. It was out of my hands. But it was not... By birth. It was my lived experiences. My father had been who had broken me. He had failed to raise me in the method which would make me normal." FB.
Ehn/PC 1/14/2024 4:35 PM
"For a moment, I detested him. I fell into the delusion that my father was at fault for my childhood. But... I have since experienced so much more and yet that disconnect remains. I was never fixed despite any of my best yet childish efforts. My efforts were unable to make any change in who I was. It was completely out of my hands. It tracks, in that sense. Are you aware of how artificial intelligence functions?" FB. "No." Josh. "It is given a command and thus it executes it. It's method of execution relies on the things it has been taught, that it has been shown... It lacks the ever mystical concept of a 'soul'. It is simply a machine which executes tasks based on information it was given. It's memories. People are the same, regardless of what they may believe. I can never 'improve' or become what someone's ideal of a good person is. I am merely who I am. And thus... So was my father. In a cosmical sense, we are all but pieces in an endless chain of events. Our bad data comes from the bad data of our parents, and theirs come from theirs, and so on and so forth. The first stone cast produces an endless chain of unstoppable ripple effects. There is no one to blame. The only answer within our grasp is self-acceptance. We are who we are simply because it is so. And thus... What point remains in self-hatred?" FB.
4:39 PM
"...So I was just destined to be Josh Maoziwam? I'm not a failure, I'm just... Supposed to be broken?" Josh. "If that is your idea of brokenness, then yes. But I believe there is a beauty in you as well. A beauty in us all. A beauty in... Futility itself, perhaps. I'm not sure that I believe in a god... But regardless, I find his creation to be beautiful. For in the supposedly endless dimensions of varying choice... We are what is real. We are what survives. You are the Josh Maoziwam, and thus the greatest Josh Maoziwam there ever was. What could be simpler than that?" FB.
Ehn/PC 1/14/2024 4:49 PM
... Josh paused. "You mentioned data. That wasn't data." "...Hm. Yes, you are correct. That anecdote was not data. It was merely analysis. The data itself... Comes from Project EHN. I am a surgeon, Mr. Maoziwam. Retired in theory, making petty change on the surface, but I remain skilled. It's what allowed me to save those of your family I could. But for the purposes of this experiment, I used those skills for a complex experimental brain surgery. The first results were... Grim." FB looks at Elizabeth's door. "But I have managed that which was believed to be impossible for a human. I removed Hav Kerloe's bad data." FB. "You erased his memories?" Josh. "Yes. I made him a shell with a pliable identity. I am not the member of TAP responsible for what comes next, but if I were... I would say that Hav Kerloe holds a chance at perfection. We can create a world with endless people free from bad data. A world where everyone is perfectly satisfied to be themselves. A world free of crime, mentall illness, tragedy, jealousy, all such unneeded negative emotions. A utopia." FB. "I don't think my father would want that." Josh. I don't know him very well, but I think he'd be terrified of a world where he isn't above everyone. In a monetary sense, as well as a more general power sense. It's all connected to money, though. That's what my father told me. I didn't listen very well, so I don't know the specifics, but it seems true. I can understand that fear, a bit. "Yes, you are correct of this at least. Your father does not strive to use this for a utopia. He wishes to create a world where he is at it's core. A world where he can never be forgotten by the living. It is fairly common of those who lust for power. But again, have no hatred. He is merely another example of a man with bad data." FB.
Ehn/PC 1/14/2024 5:40 PM
Josh looked at the doors. "I've seen enough of these." "Very well." FB nodded and lead him to near where he'd come from. "These are your family members. Shuichi Maoziwam remains comatose, while your sister is only awake by some definition." Josh peered into his sister's room to understand what that meant. Lelouch was seated there, hooked up to an IV tube and staring at the wall. "She's in shock, it seems. We are not psychologists, so we figure it best to leave her there for now. At worst we may alter her mind to forget this crash ever happened. At Shuichi's permission, of course." FB. Josh sat down next to her, but she didn't react. Ironic. It's like we've switched roles. Now you're the one with nothing to say. Maybe... We aren't that different. This is worth thinking more about.
Ehn/PC 1/14/2024 5:48 PM
Josh spent another day with FB in the laboratory. He met other people there, like Kyoko 'LC' Kirigiri, but that's not worth going into because it affected his story in no relevant way. Her role in the creation of Hav is much distant. Josh learnt of many of his father's fruitless endeavors for immortality in the public consciousness, before he finally learnt about the New Edlightenment. Their relationship with Shuichi was much more distant, built solely off of one of his beliefs about the afterlife. That once people died, they would forever become trapped in whatever emotion they died in. The New Edlightenment was a cult that used this to justify murdering happy people, but Shuichi was obviously not interested in that sort of indiscriminate murder. He was a man of self-interest, which left Josh pondering why he would ever start something like this.
Ehn/PC 1/14/2024 5:58 PM
"I believe... It was guilt." FB finally expressed his theory. "Guilt? For what?" Josh. "Hm. I'm afraid I'm unsure whether or not it's safe to tell you." FB. "You can tell me. I don't tell anyone anything." Josh. That's true in a literal sense. "I suppose no one would have any reason to believe you if you told them. Fine. In his youth, your father was very desperate to shape the empire you're so intimately familiar with now. He dug his hands into criminality, but it was difficult to do so without showing his face. He had no one to place his faith in. No children to give this sort of position to. Thus... He went abroad. He decided, in much the same way project EHN works, that he would find a lapdog he could trust with nothing but Shuichi himself. To accomplish this... He killed many people. Not directly, of course. I don't believe whatever bad data exists within him would allow him to commit such direct murders. He merely justified it all to himself in whatever way he could. But... I believe that that guilt lingered with him. Those responsible for taking a human life are often haunted by guilt far past the crime. If Johnner- Excuse me, that lapdog's story is to be believed his town was at a time of peace and happiness when he lost them all. It's a plea to exonerate himself from those deaths. He merely sent them to paradise, I suppose." FB.
6:02 PM
"Are you sure?" Josh. "Not particularly. All attempts to understand the motives of another essentially amount to projection, but our different lived experiences will always mean projections are imperfect. Perhaps Shuichi Maoziwam is simply a deranged murderer with no substance to his beliefs. Perhaps the 2 facts remain utterly unrelated. I simply make an estimation based off of what would lead me to such a conclusion. The only one who can truly understand Shuichi is himself, and I fear any answer he gave may be just as untrustworthy as my own. It remains subjective in that sense. So... who's to doubt my reading, hm?" FB smiled jokingly.
6:07 PM
"You said it was the new edlightenment, right? How can it be the new one if it's the first one? New usually implies there exists an old one." Josh. "Yes, there was an original non-murdering Edlightenment. It was murdered when one of it's disciples came to the conclusion the New Edlightenment was sprouted from. The New Edlightenment is merely recruiting family members and friends of the original victims and manipulating them based off of their loss. I believe the children are the main priority given their susceptibleness." FB. "And my father okayed this?" Josh. "You could call immorality in the eyes of the law the family business." FB. "Why do you say only in the eyes of the law? Shouldn't the law be the thing that defines morality?" Josh. "Memories, remember? What point is there in judging what is beyond one's control. Morality is a rather vague concept once you accept this." FB.
6:13 PM
"...Can I go meet one of them?" Josh wasn't entirely sure why he asked this. He included a long internal monologue about a variety of guesses, but there was no ultimate point so it's not worth repeating. Just imagine a really long one involving a bunch of obviously wrong guesses. "I'm afraid you cannot really leave. It was your father's policy to maintain a wave of secrecy until he was in control of a situation." FB. "...It's okay. I never go out. There's no one to recognize me or know who Josh Maoziwam is, anyway." Josh. "...I see. Why? No, I suppose that question may be inappropriate to ask." FB.
Ehn/PC 1/14/2024 6:21 PM
Josh managed to convince him to visit one, and thus Josh went outside on his own for the first time in a long time and visited the apartment of 'Ray Elliot', son of 2 of the original Edlightenment members. "Hello?" "...Hrrm?" Kite opened the door. Obviously, he doesn't have an eyepatch yet even if one of his eyes are gone. "Are you Ray Elliot?" Josh. "Yeah? Who's this?" Kite. Josh remembered that he couldn't use his real name, so he thought back to a name that couldn't easily be traceable to himself. Then, he remembered a name he'd seen recently on one of the doors that was normal enough to not be noteworthy without being overly common enough to seem fake. "...Shaun. My name is Shaun." Hav Kerloe's middle name. "...Shawn? Okay, so who are you Shawn? Are you with like... child protection or whatever? I'm fine. I got all the protection ever." Kite. As mentioned when this previously came up, Shawn and Sean are different characters. Different from Shaun, that is.
Ehn/PC 1/14/2024 6:31 PM
"...Whatever." Kite rolls his eyes obnoxiously. He goes back to sitting on the couch aimlessly without closing the door. Josh takes this as an invitation and sits next to Kite. This is odd. Why is the TV off? People sit down in front of TVs to watch them, but this one is off. Did he forget to turn it on? "Why is the TV off?" "Oh, I uh... I didn't pay the bill. Didn't feel like it. What's the point, y'know? Fuck life. It sucks. End of discussion." Kite shrugs. "Oh. Hm." Josh watches the blank TV in silence with him.
6:32 PM
... ... ... ... Nothing happens.
6:35 PM

6:41 PM

6:44 PM
Josh left when he was punched. Why did he hit me? It hurt. Punching feels hurt. I don't think I've ever been punched before. I guess it's nice to try new things like that sometimes. I don't think he was being nice though. Am I doing this badly? He seemed to get very upset at me for what I was saying. I guess that's not how people are supposed to behave. In times like this... I'm supposed to issue an apology. But what if that annoys him too? I don't know how to project onto people like Mr. FB does. I guess it would be best to just go home.
6:49 PM
After relaying the situation to FB, FB gave him a bit of advice. "Hm... Yes, it's not easy to intuit the reasons behind the behaviors of others sometimes. Perhaps you could simply use the basis of someone else to understand how to engage with him. Your sister is his same age, yes? That was why I picked him for you. Perhaps you simply ought to do what she would do." Josh mulled it over in his head, but ultimately agreed. The next day, he went to the store and bought comic books. They were essentially cartoons without power for the TV, so he figured that that would be what his sister would go for in that situation. He bought a lot of them, since he didn't know what the standard would be. And thus, with a massive bag of various comic books, he headed for Kite's apartment. Kite, who was still named Ray at the time. This becomes relevant later, because that's how foreshadowing works. Josh knocked. "Hello?" "Go away, dude! I don't wanna hear from you!" Kite shouted angrily and did not open the door. An instant defeat.
6:51 PM
That did not go well. It seems waiting a day wasn't long enough. If I return now, FB will probably understand that I've failed. I don't want a lecture right now, so it would be best to lie to him. I'll just wait here. So Josh sat down in the hallway for a while.
6:53 PM
... ... ... Josh eventually looked through the bag and looked at the comic books. This was an act of pure boredom from a man with nothing else to do, but he mindlessly flipped through the pages of the books.
6:59 PM
These pictures don't look real at all. Why would someone draw them like this? Just like this story, it's completely unrealistic. Someone receives superpowers and becomes a hero. Another receives superpowers and becomes a villain. It all feels very silly. Sometimes they don't have superpowers but they still act in impossible ways. What's the point? ... They're very formulaic, too. The good guy always wins, and the bad guy always loses. Why would someone read these if they always know how it's going to end? Are they stupid? ... Maybe... It's not supposed to be realistic? ... Maybe it's a metaphor. The hero and the villain each represent something. But what do they represent? Most spiders cannot talk and don't have trouble keeping jobs, because they don't have to have jobs at all. Because they are spiders. ... So, is it... About the people inside the stories?
7:03 PM
And that was when the wall broke. Josh started reading the books for the sake of reading the books. He experienced a work of fiction where someone was faced with difficulty and was able to triumph past it to be the best person he could be. It gave him hope. He kept reading, enthralled. He couldn't seem to stop reading. For reasons he couldn't bring himself to understand, he was forming a real attachment to all these characters.
7:06 PM
Kite exited his apartment. "...You're still here?" He noticed the comics. "Did you bring those? I told you I'm not accepting handouts!" "Then just borrow them. I'll take them back if you don't want to keep them." Josh. "Ugh." Kite. "You seemed bored, so I gave you something to do. They're comic books. It's like an cartoon but without the moving." Josh. "..." Kite took the bag and went back into his apartment. Naturally, Josh followed.
7:09 PM
Kite read through them. Josh had already skimmed through some of them, so he got to watch Kite's expressive reactions to various things. Josh did his best to mimic those expressions, trying to understand correct responses to situations and bad ones. When Kite finished one, Josh asked him "Did you like it?" "It's whatever. I think my mom had some before." Kite tried to suppress any reaction to this question.
7:10 PM
"You wanted to be a good person. So... Here you go. Stories about people who are good people. They're not real, but... They still matter. Like dead people." Apparently. "Uh... Thanks. I guess." Kite started reading another one, so Josh repeated the same thing as before. This time, Josh enjoyed watching his reactions. It felt like experiencing the story all over again, and it made him even more invested in the story than he'd previously been.
Ehn/PC 1/14/2024 8:39 PM
Kite kept reading more and more, and the discussion with Josh became more and more active. Eventually, they discusses the books more than they read it. "The metaphor isn't that he's a spider. It's about being special. Being forced to be someone who isn't normal, and wishing someone else had the power you wielded but being forced to cope with it every single day. And... Wishing you could be normal. I think you can probably relate to that too, right?" Josh. "I guess... Yeah. But I think it'd be pretty cool to be special, y'know? A normal guy who suffers is just a guy who suffers... But a guy who makes something out of that, like... That's the kind of guy they write stories about, y'know?" Kite. "But what about special people who don't suffer?" Josh. "Then I guess those are just... Villains, right? I mean all the heroes get pain, right?" Kite.
8:42 PM
Later, their discussion ended, and Josh went back to the lab to see FB. "I did it. I think... I understood his perspective a little." Josh. "Congratulations. It seems your life is headed in a positive direction, no?" FB. "I have a request, FB." Josh. "Oh? What is it." FB. "I want you to make me someone else. I want to be a normal person who has no idea who Josh Maoziwam even is. I imagine it's not often you get a voluntary test subject, so... Please operate on me. I don't really mind if I die. There's no one who'd feel sad to lose me. But... Maybe someone would be able to care about the person I become. So please kill Josh Maoziwam and make me into someone better." Josh.
Ehn/PC 1/18/2024 11:23 AM
FB observed him silently for a moment. "Are you certain?" "Yes." Josh. "While I understand your desire... I don't believe it will be an option. Your father remains in charge of this. If I were to do this without his consent, it would be impossible to explain this. The project as a whole would be shut down." FB. "Then tell him you had to do it. To save me." My father has been comatose since the accident. That means he won't know what happened at all until he wakes up one day. When people don't know things, you can lie to them about it. Only the people here have seen what happened to me, and they want to keep the project going. Project EHN is their comic book. Josh answered begrudgingly.
11:26 AM
The next day, Kite and Josh read more comic books. Kite engaged in the practice of LARPing, where Josh would resign himself to the role of a simple sidekick. They lacked anyone to play the villain, which left their game incomplete, but Kite seemed to enjoy himself regardless. They played with an old crowbar they'd found in an alleyway outside his house, while Josh used a trash can lid as a shield. Eventually, Kite agreed to let Josh pay the electric bill. (edited)
Ehn/PC 1/18/2024 11:37 AM
Josh went back to FB later and arranged for what he'd promised. "...I see. That can be done, yes. It seems you've been doing well with the boy. Congratulations." FB. "Thank you." Josh nodded. "I have a... Son-like figure in my life as well. I don't believe we'll ever manage to connect on any true level, but perhaps one day he will come to understand what I've done for him like Ray has for you." FB. "I hope not." Josh. "Hm. In any case, we've had trouble designing a personality for our test subject, Nathan Smith. LC seems far too intent on just making another of herself, a notion that seems far too ridiculous. Even IO, LM, CR, SM, and RF... They all seem to have a far too personal interest in simply making another of themselves." FB. "Why not combine all of them?" Josh. "That seems highly dangerous, I admit. All of them are deeply unstable people, by any metric. At most... We would need some sort of positive influence. A good person to add into the complex sludge of people this would create. A bonding agent of sorts for various traits of theirs to unite." FB. Josh holds out a comic book towards FB. "These are what good people are." FB grabs it and examines it. "...A fictional character? There would be no point. These sorts of fantastical scenarios cannot exist within reality." FB. "They're a metaphor. They have a lot to say about human beings. I think... They might be more real than people." Josh.
11:41 AM
Josh and FB discusses fiction for a while after that. There's no point recreating their whole conversation, it's just repeating preexisting traits of their characters and making some sort of overly self-indulgent meta-analysis. What would be the point of that? Who wants to see a story go on and on about the nature of stories? You know the way stories work and what they mean. All they'd be doing is going through a huge loop of complicated words to talk about their own philosophies, philosophies which they never even shut up about in the first place. It doesn't matter. The next day, Josh goes to see Kite again and they watch cartoons. Or, anime. It's anime. Josh doesn't know the name of the genre but it's anime.

Ehn/PC 1/18/2024 11:57 AM

Kite. "Kites fly high above people, all on their own. They don't need to do anything particularly important, but they still somehow apparently bring people joy. Ehn/PC 1/18/2024 12:05 PM

Kite. Why? "That makes sense." Josh.
12:08 PM
They proceeded with this routine for several more days. In the meantime, FB's tests looked more promising. Josh knew he'd be allowed to fade away any day now, so he preemptively passed on Kite's wishes to FB as his own. To never let Kite's fantasies interact with the new edlightenment. It'd mean he'd be a lot more lonely, but Josh didn't have any strong negative conception of loneliness. On the last day he'd see Kite, Josh brought him a video game to play. Masquerade V. Josh didn't quite understand how it worked, but it was apparently a cartoon you could control. That seemed like the natural next step to him.
12:12 PM
As they played, Josh suddenly asked. "Do you ever think about death?" "Sometimes. But like... I don't really wanna die, y'know? 12:14 PM

I don't like to cry. "Punch me, Kite." Josh. "What?" Kite. "Punch me. Pain makes the feelings go away." Josh. "..." Kite looked nervously at Josh before punching him in the face. Josh fell over and felt his bleeding nose. Concentrate on that pain. He followed his own advice, and the pain distracted his pain. The tears that fell from his face were only red, now.
12:21 PM
"I think... I should go, Kite. ...Bro." Josh. "Huh...? Uh, okay." Kite. "I'll see you tomorrow." Josh quickly left and went back to FB's laboratory. "It's ready, Josh." FB told him as he arrived. If you don't do it now, you likely never will have the chance again. The choice between being Josh Maoziwam and being a normal person lays in your hands." FB.
Ehn/PC 1/18/2024 12:29 PM
I- No. I should- I can- This- But- That- I don't- A coherent monologue failed to structure in Josh's mind. Instead, he spoke the words he didn't want to. "I can't." "What? Why not?" FB. "There's... Someone relying on me. For the first time in my life... I don't think I could die. I think for whatever reason... The world needs me to keep on living. Kite needs me." Josh. "Kite? His name is Ray Elliot. He is feeding you objects of fantasy, Josh. You are a broken person like many are. But unlike those, you can be fixed. I can fix you right now. You are no longer bound by the existential horror of self." FB. "I understand, but... You said we don't have a choice in life. You told me we don't get a choice. I think this is the choice I don't get to make. Josh Maoziwam needs to live, for whatever reason." Josh. "No... You just want to believe that. You want to engage in a fantasy impossible in reality. I understand, Josh. I've been through the same thing you have. There is no light at the end of this tunnel. You must either adapt to the darkness or... Take the exit I provide you." FB. "But it won't be me taking the exit, will it? It'll be the person you create. It'll be someone who never even knew he was broken." Josh. "These are emotional arguments now. You are not justifying why you must live, but why you want to live. The darkness if not where you belong, Josh. If you won't take this escape for yourself anymore... Please... Please do it for me. Take the young FB who dreamt of a better self... And let him be born into the self you wanted." FB.
12:31 PM
"Can't you do that yourself?" Josh. "I am old, Josh. Even if someone else could handle the procedure, I would likely die during it. Let me help you, Josh." FB. "...Okay." Josh conceded. "But..." "Allow me to care for Kite. You told me he knew you by Sean, yes?" FB. "Yeah." Josh. "You don't need to take your worries into your new self. I shall handle them." FB. "Okay." Josh finally nodded.
12:36 PM
FB led him into a room near the 3 EHN rooms and laid him down in a surgery bed. "...When you wake up, Josh Maoziwam will cease to exist." "I understand." Josh. "Do you wish to leave with any final words?" FB. "Just... A request." Josh. "What is it?" FB prepared the anesthetic. "My sister... She isn't broken. I think she's happy. So... Please don't do this to her. Let her return on her own." Josh. "And how are you so sure I shall follow through with that suggestion?" FB injected it. "I think... I think you're a good man, Mr. FB. Even if I hope... you die... soon..." Josh lost consciousness for the final time. Hav Kerloe awoke in his bed, inside his Avengard apartment for the first time. Naturally, he had done this many times before in his mind. But today remained a special day. Today, he would open Kerloe Fishery.

Josh Maoziwam 1/20/2024 2:55 PM
I look out my window and see the city from my apartment. The city's name is Avengardâ€”I've sometimes wondered why it's called that, but I know it doesn't matter. It's interesting how people think that places deserve names. It's also interesting how people think that people deserve names. It's Wednesday, a day of the week, something which also is named by society, for whatever reason. Today is an important day, because I'll be opening the fish store. It will be named Kerloe Fishery, which is the simplest possible name to describe its function, and my presence within it. I turn away from the window, noting how many people are also waking up at the same time as I am within this city known as Avengard. On the other end of my turn is the fish tank, which I need to maintain. In doing so, the lives of the fish continue. As I give them food, their life continues, which is absolutely wonderful. Their existence barely matters at all. They're just like me. The lives of fish are truly indescribably beautiful. I pick up the fish food container, unscrew the cap of the fish food, pour the fish food into the tank, screw the cap back on, place it onto the table, then exit the bedroom. (edited)
Ehn/PC 1/20/2024 2:56 PM
This happens.
Josh Maoziwam 1/20/2024 3:04 PM
I enter the second room of the apartment, which is a "kitchen", but I prefer to call it a fish room. Like "Kerloe Fishery", this is a much more descriptive term; rather than pretending the fish room has any individuality, I simply describe it for what it is. The reason the fish room is a fish room is, of course, because of the several fish tanks contained within it, as well as the nature of its use as a place to both cook and eat fish. I enter the final room of the apartment, the restroom. I take the toothbrush and brush my teeth, which is something I do every morning. However, I can't quite figure out why I do this. Something about that feels meaningful to meâ€”an act that is repeated every single day, yet one that's purpose is unfathomable. I reenter the fish room, and take another tube of fish foodâ€”of which I have multipleâ€”unscrewing it, and pouring some fish food into each of the tanks. Just like the fish in the bedroom, these fish are being kept alive by the fish food. They look different, but their function is the same. Their fate is also the same. They are worthless, yet they are more important than anything else to ever exist. I take my keys and exit my apartment, locking the door behind me. (edited)
